featureContentItems.hed: The 15 Most Romantic Places in the World
featureContentItems.dek: It doesn't need to be Valentine's Day to get a little romantic. Sweep your sweetheart off his or her feet and head to one of these swoon-worthy destinations, full of history and superstition.

Candlelit dinners on Wailea Beach? Couples’ massage classes by the ocean? Romantic day trips to hidden Maui waterfalls? Don’t worry—we got you. Just in time for Valentine’s Day, we rounded up the most romantic Hawaiian getaways of them all.

featureContentItems.hed: Vintage Photos of Kissing Along Paris’ Seine River
featureContentItems.dek: Few activities scream romance quite like a leisurely walk along the Seine River in Paris—and these vintage photos prove that the famed waterway has been a draw for ages.

featureContentItems.hed: The Ideal Romantic Weekend Getaway Is…
10 British Hotels for Every Type of Honeymooner
The Best Way to Book a Last-Minute Valentine's Day Trip

featureContentItems.dek: It doesn't need to be Valentine's Day to get a little romantic. Sweep your sweetheart off his or her feet and head to one of these swoon-worthy destinations, full of history and superstition.
featureContentItems.hed: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World

items.title: Ellis Island
items.caption: Long ago, many joyful family reunions happened at a gate known as the “kissing post.” Share a peck in front of the plaque that stands in its place today, on the first floor in the west wing of the **[building](http://www.ellisisland.org/)**.

items.title: Kiribati
items.caption: Start planning ahead: If you spend New Year’s Eve on this **[Pacific island](http://www.kiribatitourism.gov.ki/)**, which borders the international dateline, you’ll be the first couple in the world to ring in the year with a kiss.

items.title: The Rodin Museum
items.caption: Re-create the passion depicted in the 19th-century sculpture, _The Kiss,_ before taking a romantic stroll in **[the museum](http://www.musee-rodin.fr)**’s rambling rose garden.

items.title: The Kissing Bench
items.caption: Legend says that if a couple kisses while sitting on **[this stone bench](http://archives.syr.edu/exhibits/spirit_social.html) **at Syracuse University, they’ll eventually marry.

items.title: The Bridge of Sighs
items.caption: According to Italian superstition, kiss your sweetheart on a gondola at sunset under **[this 17th-century bridge](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bridge_of_Sighs)**, and you'll be guaranteed eternal love.
The ferris wheel at Santa Monica Pier

items.title: Hôtel de Ville
items.caption: Star in your own version of Robert Doisneau’s iconic photograph, _The Kiss on the Sidewalk,_ by visiting Paris’s city hall, the [**Hôtel de Ville**](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hôtel_de_Ville,_Paris). (To kiss in the exact spot, stand across from the “C” at the café.)

items.title: Lovers Point
items.caption: Head here at the crack of dawn and share a morning kiss; because it faces east, it’s one of the only spots on the west coast where you watch the sun rise over the water.

items.title: Juliet's Balcony
items.caption: Shakespeare’s star-crossed sweethearts declared undying love for one another here. Kiss beneath **[the balcony](http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g187871-d246496-Reviews-Juliet_s_House_Casa_di_Giulietta-Verona_Province_of_Verona_Veneto.html)** before parting, with such sweet sorrow.

items.title: The Eiffel Tower
items.caption: Once dubbed “the metal asparagus,” the **[Eiffel Tower](http://www.tour-eiffel.fr)** is now arguably one of the most romantic spots in the world. Take an elevator to the third level, and share a French kiss over the city.

items.title: The Empire State Building
items.caption: Salute _Sleepless in Seattle_ (or have your own _Affair to Remember_) by making a pilgrimage to this **[New York landmark](http://www.esbnyc.com/)**. (Our advice: Skip rush hour and make a late-night trip to the top—you can go as late as 1:15am.)

items.title: Kingda Ka Rollercoaster at Six Flags Great Adventure
items.caption: Experts say that thrills get your endorphins pumping, which makes you more attracted to those around you. Kiss at the top of the first hill on **[the world’s tallest rollercoaster](http://www.sixflags.com/greatadventure/rides/kingdaka.aspx)**—it’s 45 stories high!—and hang on to each other as you plummet.

items.title: The Kissing Bridge
items.caption: This **[rickety covered bridge](http://www.woolwich.ca/en/tourism/thingstodo_kissing_bridge.asp)** might not look like much, but the dreamy light inside earned it its name. It was originally built in 1881 and is Ontario's last remaining covered bridge.

items.title: Père Lachaise Cemetery
items.caption: Here lies author and poet Oscar Wilde, whose devotees covered his tomb in **[layers of kisses](http://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/16/world/europe/oscar-wildes-tomb-sealed-from-admirers-kisses.html?pagewanted=all)** over the years. In 2011, the tomb was cleaned, and a seven-foot glass wall was erected—but now visitors leave kisses on the glass. Swipe on some red lipstick, and add yours.

items.title: Alley of the Kiss
items.caption: Two lovers living on opposite sides of this **[slender alley](http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g150799-d153080-Reviews-Alley_of_the_Kiss_Callejon_del_Beso-Guanajuato_Central_Mexico_and_Gulf_Coast.html)** once perished side-by-side here; since then, locals have allegedly spotted their ghosts smooching on the balconies. Today, local lore says that couples who kiss on the third step in the alley will be rewarded with years of happiness.

featureContentItems.seoTitle: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World

featureContentItems.socialTitle: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World

featureContentItems.dek: Candlelit dinners on Wailea Beach? Couples’ massage classes by the ocean? Romantic day trips to hidden Maui waterfalls? Don’t worry—we got you. Just in time for Valentine’s Day, we rounded up the most romantic Hawaiian getaways of them all.

items.title: Four Seasons Maui
items.caption: It’s no wonder that most guests at the [Four Seasons Maui](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/kihei/four-seasons-maui-at-wailea) are honeymooners, babymooners, or couples celebrating their anniversary: romance oozes from every corner. From unforgettable sunsets over Wailea Beach to the West Maui Mountain views from the adults-only Serenity Pool (one of our [favorite pools](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/2) on the island), you won’t find a better backdrop for rekindling romance. This Valentine’s Day, spend the afternoon practicing massage techniques on one another at a couples’ instructional massage class on the beach. Afterward, enjoy a private, custom, multi-course oceanfront dinner, complete with wine and candlelight. Cliché? We prefer to think it’s classic.

items.title: Halekulani Hotel
items.caption: Honolulu's iconic [Halekulani Hotel](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/honolulu/halekulani--waikiki) inspires romance all year round, thanks to that [gorgeous orchid pool](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/5), and sweeping ocean views. If the ambiance alone isn't romantic enough for you, Halekulani will also sponsor your date night with complimentary tickets to the Hawaii Symphony Orchestra. Or, if you'd prefer, you can enjoy an art tour of Honolulu and stroll hand-in-hand through the former residence of a Hawaiian king and queen. This Valentine's Day, don't miss SpaHalekulani's "Celebrate Love" package: a couple's massage paired with custom-blended essential oils followed, naturally, by chocolates and champagne.

items.title: St. Regis Princeville Resort
items.caption: [This resort](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/princeville/st--regis-princeville--kauai) will surely make you fall in love—if not with your partner, then certainly with the spectacular views surrounding you. It's nestled in a quiet cove overlooking gorgeous Hanalei Bay and Bali Hai, with a rocky, secluded beach better suited for romantic sunset strolls than swimming. This Valentine's Day, the resort's Halele'a Spa is offering a sumptuous champagne scrub, finished off with a body butter treatment made using locally-sourced Ali'i lavender. Afterward, indulge in a four-course private dinner illuminated by torchlight on secluded Kamani Cove, or dine at the resort's very own [Jean-Georges restaurant](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-09/food-photos-hawaii-beautiful-dishes-instagram/5). Cap off the evening with a cocktail and a midnight soak in the resort's 24/7 hot tub.

items.title: Sheraton Waikiki Hotel
items.caption: If your definition of romance involves hitting the town in high style, then the [Sheraton Waikiki](http://www.sheraton-waikiki.com/) is where you need to be. Smack in the middle of Waikiki Beach, it's a stone's throw away from some of Honolulu's most romantic restaurants and hottest nightclubs, and is home to the best pool bar in town, The Edge of Waikiki. Young-at-heart couples will find nothing more romantic than floating on those signature orange beanbags, hand-in-hand (mai tai in the other), watching the sun set over bustling Waikiki. Ask about their Romance Packages, which gets you an ocean view and a complimentary bottle of champagne.

items.title: Andaz Maui at Waliea
items.caption: Judging from the crowd alone, the sleek lobby of the [Andaz Maui](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/wailea/andaz-maui-at-wailea) could easily be mistaken for a Brooklyn boutique hotel: it's studded with abstract art and hip, skinny jeans-clad couples who look like they've just stepped off the subway. This is the place to be if your idea of romance includes artisanal cocktails by an edgy pool ( [or four](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/3)) and an organic, locally-sourced, farm-to-table dinner with your sweetheart. This Valentine's Day, have their (young, super hip) concierge organize a private waterfall tour of East Maui—because what's more romantic than sharing a kiss beneath your own secret, 40-foot waterfall?

items.title: The Royal Hawaiian
items.caption: We promise, we didn't just choose [this hotel](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/honolulu/royal-hawaiian--luxury-collection-) because it's pink—besides its hue, it's got so much to offer in the way of romance. First, there are suites with enormous soaking tubs and views over the ocean. Then (if you can drag yourself out of that tub) there's the Abhasa Spa, where you can get a couples' massage beneath the shade of swaying palms inside the hotel's own coconut grove. Finally, there's a spectacular Valentine's Day prix fixe at its acclaimed Azure restaurant, where you can expect an abundance of truffles, oysters and to-die-for desserts (check out the full V-Day menu [here](http://www.azurewaikiki.com/pdf/valentines-day-15.pdf)). This Valentine's Day, a Romance Package will get you breakfast in bed, and flowers and champagne upon arrival.

items.title: Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort and Spa
items.caption: With its location on windy Shipwreck beach and its labyrinth of gorgeous pools and lagoons, the [Grand Hyatt Kauai](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/koloa/grand-hyatt-kauai-resort-and-spa) is like a gigantic, romantic adult playground. There's a waterfall and freshwater grotto to swim in, and an outdoor fire pit to snuggle by. This Valentine's Day, indulge in a couples' treatment at the resort's award-winning Anara Spa, followed by dinner at its famous floating restaurant, Tidepools—frequently called out as one of the most romantic in the country.
items.credit: Courtesy Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort And Spa

items.title: Four Seasons Resort Hualalai
items.caption: With its secluded black sand beaches and deep, lush valleys, the Big Island might just be the most romantic of all Hawaii's islands. The [Four Seasons Resort Hualalai](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/big-island/four-seasons-hualalai-at-historic-ka-upulehu--big-island), on the island's Kona-Kohala Coast, plays up that drama: it's built upon a backdrop of turquoise ocean, black lava, and lush green vegetation. If you can manage to tear yourself away from the stunning scenery and back into your bungalow-style digs, we suggest splurging on an in-room duet massage, followed by the "Love Potion" experience: an in-room martini-making kit, plus vanilla-scented candles, strawberries, and a pot of melted chocolate for dipping (or drizzling).

items.title: Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa
items.caption: We know what you're thinking: romance? At a [family-friendly resort](http://cntraveler.com/united-states/kapolei/aulani-disney-resort--oahu)? Don't judge a book by its cover: Mickey and Minnie know you need your alone time, too. Kick off Valentine's Day by dropping the kids off at Aunty's Beach House, open until 9:30 pm. Saunter over to Kula Wai, a 5,000-square-foot hydrotherapy garden where you and your sweetheart can soak together in purifying volcanic mud bath, followed by a traditional *lomilomi* couples' massage. Spend the afternoon exploring scenic Ko'Olina Lagoon, and then enjoy a sunset champagne toast at the adults-only Wailana pool bar. You'll emerge from your date feeling relaxed, sunkissed and—dare we say—sexy.
items.credit: Courtesy Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa

items.title: Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay
items.caption: Perched atop a craggy, red lava cliff above a white sand beach, the views from [this resort](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/lanai-city/four-seasons-lana-i-at-manele-bay) look like something out of a movie. The accommodations are equally swoon-worthy: oceanfront suites boast deep Japanese wooden soaking tubs and generous lanais, perfect for sunset-watching. This Valentine's Day, take your S.O. to the resort's boutique perfumery to create your own custom fragrance together. Couples can choose from over 200 different scents—made from 100% natural and indigenous Hawaiian ingredients—to craft into the perfect olfactory souvenir.
items.credit: Courtesy Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay

items.title: THE MODERN Honolulu
items.caption: If you're in Honolulu and looking for a Valentine's Day experience that's a little more intimate and low-key, [THE MODERN](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/oahu/the-modern-honolulu)'s your best bet. It's away from the main drag of chain hotels on Waikiki, and is home to the island's sexiest cocktail bar, which is literally hidden behind a rotating wall of books off the lobby. Kick off your Valentine's Day with their "Breakfast in Daybed," where they'll set you up with a mimosa bar and brunch on a daybed by the Sunrise Pool. Afterward, indulge in a couple's in-room spa treatment, have a romantic [lunch at Morimoto](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-09/food-photos-hawaii-beautiful-dishes-instagram/8) and then watch the sun set with a cocktail by the aptly-named, adults-only Sunset Pool, outfitted with hammocks roomy enough for two.

items.title: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa
items.caption: No wonder it's one of the most popular places to get married in Honolulu: with its elegant, plantation style architecture, dramatic pillared _porte-cochere_ and dripping crystal chandeliers, the [Moana Surfrider](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/honolulu/moana-surfrider-a-westin-resort-and-spa) certainly _looks_ like the most romantic hotel in all of Waikiki. Spend this Valentine's Day enjoying contemporary island cuisine at its gorgeous Beachhouse restaurant (on this year's menu: oysters, Alaskan king crab, and red velvet cake), indulging in a couples' hot stone treatment, or simply sitting beneath the 150-foot branches of its historic banyan tree, doing absolutely nothing at all.
items.credit: Courtesy Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa

items.title: Mauna Lani Bay Hotel & Bungalows
items.caption: Since its opening in 1983, [the Mauna Lani](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/kamuela/mauna-lani-bay-hotel---bungalows--big-island) has been a favorite among honeymooners, and it remains one of the Big Island's most classically beautiful resorts. Besides its dreamy Kohala Coast location, the main draw for couples is its fantastic spa—a sheer volcanic oasis that's arguably the best on the island. Couples can steam together in the open-air, volcanic rock sauna, or indulge in simultaneous treatments in the lava-enhanced saltwater Watsu Pool. For the ultimate Valentine's Day experience, splurge on a bungalow for your own oceanfront private plunge pool.
items.credit: Courtesy Mauna Lani Bay Hotel & Bungalows

fields.name: Krisanne Fordham
fields.shortBio: Krisanne Fordham is a contributing editor at *Condé Nast Traveler*
fields.bio: Krisanne Fordham is a contributing digital editor at *Condé Nast Traveler* and a writer for CNN Travel, *Departures* and *Travel + Leisure.* Previously, she was a staff editor at *Condé Nast Traveler* and The AOL-Huffington Post Media Group. Krisanne grew up in Sydney, Australia and splits her time between New York and Italy.

featureContentItems.hed: French Kiss: Vintage Photos of Romance Along Paris's Seine River
featureContentItems.dek: Few activities scream romance quite like a leisurely walk along the Seine River in Paris—and these vintage photos prove that the famed waterway has been a draw for ages.

items.title: __Paris, 1962__
items.caption:
“Back then, everyone was kissing in the streets,” recalls Hans Mauli of his image of a couple embracing along the Seine. The 77-year-old Swiss-born photographer came upon the pair—possibly students, judging from the workbook at her side—close to the Sorbonne and the Boulevard St-Michel. “I leaned over the stone wall and held the camera in my outstretched hands,” says Mauli, who shot only one frame of the young lovers. Known for his black-and-white photography, he rarely used color film due to the expense. “I didn’t have much money at the time, so I often kept unprocessed film for years,” Mauli says. Though he knew he had taken a good shot, he didn’t print it until some 35 years later. Mauli, who now lives in St. Helena, California, still believes Paris is a city that inspires romance (“Everything is beautiful—the light, the architecture, the river”), but he isn’t sure there are as many displays of public passion these days: “So many people are looking at their smartphones instead of looking at each other.” 

For more vintage photos of romance on the Seine, click through the slideshow…
Kissing near the Eiffel Tower.
A couple embraces on the banks of the Seine.
items.credit: © Thurston Hopkins / Picture Post / Getty Images

items.caption: A courting couple kissing on the steps on the bank of the river.
items.credit: © Fred Van Schagen / BIPs / Hulton Archive / Getty Images

items.caption: Lovers on the quayside beside the Seine.
Lovers walk past barges on the Seine.
A couple in a hidden nook near the river.
Lovers on one of Paris's many bridges.
More couples have a romantic liaison on the waterfront.
A couple embraces in front of the Notre Dame, Ile-de-France.
Kissing during the flooding of the Seine in 1978.

items.title: Circa 1983
items.caption: Summer on the banks of the Seine.
Young lovers set up camp by the water on a beautiful, clear day.

items.title: Circa 2005
items.caption: A young couple near Notre Dame.

featureContentItems.hed: He Said/She Said: The Ideal Romantic Weekend Getaway Is...
featureContentItems.dek: It's a case of he said/she said. We asked *Condé Nast Traveler* readers to recommend hotels, resorts, cities, and islands for romantic weekend getaways within the U.S.—and to Canada, Mexico, the Caribbean, and Europe—on the Readers' Choice Survey, and divided the results by gender. Though there were some similarities, men and women had very different ideas about where they would order champagne, throw rose petals, and dim the lights.

items.title: __In the U.S:__ Men flocked to the West Coast.
items.caption:
Men didn't shy away from decidedly feminine frills at the [Château du Sureau](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/oakhurst/chateau-du-sureau--oakhurst) in Oakhurst, California. Maybe it was the fact that this elegant Relais & Châteaux property is within striking distance of the wild wonders of Yosemite National Park?

Along the incredibly scenic Pacific Coast Highway, [Brewery Gulch Inn](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/mendocino/brewery-gulch-inn) in Mendocino was another favorite.

items.title: Women preferred the East Coast.
items.caption:
Sticking to the Relais & Châteaux stable was all women had in common with men. They chose the opposite side of the country, and [The Wauwinet](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/nantucket/the-wauwinet--nantucket) on Massachusett’s Nantucket island. This top-rated seasonal escape (open May through October) has two private beaches, Pratesi sheets in rooms and cottages, and a no-kids-under-12 policy. 

They also loved neighboring Rhode Island's [Castle Hill Inn & Resort](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/newport/castle-hill-inn---resort--newport) at the entrance to Newport's lively harbor.

items.title: Women wanted a spa vacation.
items.caption:
Top choices for U.S. resorts revealed a different, non-geographic, division. Women liked places with top-notch spas; [Winvian](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/morris/winvian--litchfield-hills) in Connecticut’s Litchfield Hills was their top pick. With only 18 cottages on 113 acres of quintessential New England countryside, Winvian’s most romantic abode is a treehouse, 35 feet above the forest floor, with a wood-burning fireplace and Jacuzzi. 

Additional picks included North Carolina's [Westglow Resort and Spa](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/blowing-rock/westglow-resort-and-spa) in Blowing Rock.

items.title: Men liked the mountains.
items.caption:
Few resorts have such a masculine-sounding timbre: Named after a famed Norwegian Olympic skier in the 1950s, the [Stein Eriksen Lodge](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/ogden/stein-eriksen-lodge--park-city) in Park City, Utah was a *Traveler* gent's top pick for amorous weekends away. Perhaps it’s the fresh mountain air, winter or summer, which this place delivers in spades? Or the resort's 10,000-bottle wine cellar and 145 fireplaces? There's a 23,000-square-foot spa to boot.

Men were also drawn to the hills (for everything other than the sound of music) at the [Four Seasons Resort Vail](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/vail/four-seasons-resort-vail).

items.title: In fact, men really liked Colorado.
items.caption:
Male readers couldn’t get enough of tiny Telluride, Colorado (population 2,319). It’s rugged, funky, and a relationship-bonding six-hour drive from airports in Denver or Albuquerque. Another option for getting here is to fly into the nation’s highest commercial airport via private plane (no commercial service, yet). 

The Old West lives on, but both genders agreed on their next best choice of U.S. cities… perennially fascinating __Charleston, South Carolina__, and California's windswept __Carmel-by-the-Sea__.

items.title: While women picked Napa above all else.
items.caption: Women gave high praise to the heart of California’s wine country, naming Napa their favorite U.S. city for a weekend away. Although not Victorian like Healdsburg, nor quaint like Rutherford, its modern riverside locale hit the spot. Proximity to an endless variety of vineyards must have helped. A Mediterranean climate (sunny and dry), fabulous dining, and shopping sealed the deal.

items.title: Women wanted island hotels with a side of history.
items.caption:
Resisting the charms of __Nantucket__ proved difficult for women. With their no. 1 pick for hotel, this top island proved to be a winner. Getting there by air is a snap in summer, more of a challenge by sea in winter. A near-Puritanical code of building restrictions here has led to what could be deemed an island trapped in a time warp. It’s all very, very pretty, and watch your Ps & Qs as you explore it.

Straight-laced in a different way, __Aquidneck Island__, home to Newport’s mansions of the Gilded Age and the country’s largest concentration of colonial American homes, was a solid second favorite.

items.title: Men liked U.S. islands with links.
items.caption:
Southern hospitality, and a mild year-round climate, led those most inclined to search for holes-in-one to the coastal golf courses of South Carolina and Georgia. Rated the top U.S. island this year in the Readers' Choice Awards, tranquil Kiawah beat Maui for the first time in more than 20 years (overall). Quite an accomplishment for such a sleepy getaway.

Ranked no. 2 for men in search of a dreamy weekend away was Georgia’s Sea Island. Visitors beware: You have to at least know what the “back nine” is.

items.title: __In Canada:__ Women took to the Canadian Rockies.
items.caption:
Traveling north, across the border, women and men shared a proclivity for the Canadian Rockies, but not the same spot. Women went for __Whistler__ and the [Four Seasons Resort](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/canada/whistler/four-seasons-resort-whistler). Set in the heart of a pedestrian village in North America's largest ski resort, who knew you could tee off from a glacier in winter, or an Arnold Palmer-designed course in fair weather? 

Other British Columbia favorites included [The Fairmont Chateau Whistler](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/canada/whistler/fairmont-chateau-whistler), which provided just enough adventure with the right amount of one-on-one down-time.

items.title: But men went one time zone east.
items.caption:
Guys took to __Lake Louise__ for weekend getaways. Two hours from Calgary, and under an hour from Banff, the [Post Hotel & Spa](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/canada/lake-louise/post-hotel---spa--lake-louise) knocked their socks off. Another Relais & Châteaux property (they seem to know their market), the lodge has had quite a past. First opened in 1942, it changed hands to a British nobleman soon after, before two Swiss brothers took over in the late 1970s. 

Nearby [Moraine Lake Lodge](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/canada/lake-louise/moraine-lake-lodge--banff) held a venerable second places here in the middle of Canada.

items.title: __In Europe__: Men picked Spain (and the lure of Iberian food).
items.caption:
Moving across the Atlantic for a bit of Old World romance, men made the surprising pick of __San Sebastián__ in Spain’s Basque Country as their no.1 spot.

Keeping in the same region, a runner-up was the stunning capital of Spain’s island of Mallorca: __Palma__.

items.title: While women sought out classy French resorts.
items.caption:
Classic Atlantic-coast __Biarritz__, in France, was a winner. Little wonder, as the [Hôtel du Palais](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/france/biarritz/hotel-du-palais--biarritz), built in 1855 for Empress Eugénie, wife of Napoleon III, couldn’t be more of a fairy-tale escape.

Chic __Saint-Tropez__ on the French Riviera was a no-brainer for an alternative.

items.title: They both agreed on Italy, but women wanted the sea views...
items.caption:
For places to stay in Europe, both genders agreed on properties in Italy, with female readers choosing the [Grand Hotel Miramare](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/italy/santa-margherita-ligure/grand-hotel-miramare--portofino) in Santa Margherita Ligure. Close to the as-yet-to-be-discovered city of Genoa, and much-photographed town of Portofino, this was an astute pick.

The [Palazzo Avino](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/italy/castiglione-di-ravello/palazzo-avino--formerly-palazzo-sasso---ravello) in Ravello was another favorite.

items.title: ...while men preferred city escapes and wine country.
items.caption:
Men stuck firmly to Tuscany. [Il Salviatino](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/italy/fiesole/il-salviatino), on the Fiesole hills above Florence, was their favorite. With gorgeous over-the-top rooms and jaw-dropping views (far enough from crowded city streets, but close enough to visit by taxi), this was an ideal spot to be.

Upping the game, male readers would splurge on a room or suite at the incomparable [Four Seasons Hotel Firenze](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/italy/florence/four-seasons-hotel-firenze--florence).

items.title: __In Mexico:__ Men swam in the Pacific.
items.caption:
When it came to beach resorts in Mexico, men and women again picked opposite coasts. Gents went for [Esperanza](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/mexico/san-lucas/esperanza--cabo-san-lucas) on the Cabo peninsula. Perfectly situated between Cabo San Lucas and San José del Cabo, the resort reopens in March 2015 following Hurricane Odile repairs.

Another Baja pick: the recently reopened (and rebranded) [The Resort at Pedregal](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/mexico/san-lucas/capella-pedregal--cabo-san-lucas) (formerly Capella).

items.title: Women dipped their toes in the Caribbean.
items.caption:
Mexico’s Caribbean appealed most to women, and all-inclusive, adults-only resorts like [Secrets Silversands Riviera Cancún](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/mexico/puerto-morelos/secrets-silversands-riviera-cancun) at that, just south of Cancún proper.

A similar standout was [Excellence Playa Mujeres](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/mexico/quintana-roo/excellence-playa-mujeres) just north of the popular resort area.

items.title: __In the Caribbean:__ They actually agreed on something!
items.caption:
To assure you of a genuine crossover, men and women both agreed on their favorite Caribbean & Atlantic islands. Tiny __Culebra, Puerto Rico__, was a must-visit for both. A 15-minute flight on Cape Air from San Juan, Culebra remains a secret (for now). Empty beaches and a laid-back vibe only add to the appeal.

Neighboring __Vieques__ also rated highly for weekends getaways. Here, [El Blok](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/vieques/el-blok) is a stunning, ultra-modern newcomer.

items.title: Minor quibbles aside, both were charmed by Bermuda.
items.caption:
For upscale resorts in the Caribbean & Atlantic, men and women both voted for properties in [Bermuda](http://www.cntraveler.com/stories/2015-01-23/visiting-bermuda-on-the-eve-of-major-new-developments). Guys liked [The Reefs](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/bermuda/hill-view/the-reefs-resort---club--bermuda): A cliff side location, above a perfect pink-sand beach, in Southampton Parish, got top marks.

Next up? Idyllic [Eden Rock - St Barths](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/saint-barthelemy/gustavia/eden-rock-st--barths) on St. Jean Beach.

items.title: Both found paradise.
items.caption: Female readers rounded out their list with [Rosewood Tucker’s Point](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/bermuda/hamilton/rosewood-tucker-s-point--bermuda) in Bermuda, aka “The Jewel of the Atlantic.”

featureContentItems.seoTitle: He Said/She Said: The Ideal Romantic Weekend Getaway Is...
featureContentItems.seoDescription: It's a case of he said/she said. We asked *Condé Nast Traveler* readers to recommend hotels, resorts, cities, and islands for romantic weekend getaways within the U.S.—and to Canada, Mexico, the Caribbean, and Europe—on the Readers' Choice Survey, and divided the results by gender. Though there were some similarities, men and women had very different ideas about where they would order champagne, throw rose petals, and dim the lights.
featureContentItems.socialTitle: He Said/She Said: The Ideal Romantic Weekend Getaway Is...
featureContentItems.socialDescription: It's a case of he said/she said. We asked *Condé Nast Traveler* readers to recommend hotels, resorts, cities, and islands for romantic weekend getaways within the U.S.—and to Canada, Mexico, the Caribbean, and Europe—on the Readers' Choice Survey, and divided the results by gender. Though there were some similarities, men and women had very different ideas about where they would order champagne, throw rose petals, and dim the lights.

fields.title: The African Queen
fields.caption: In myth and in movies, river trips are a kind of karmic exam. Of what stuff are you made—and will it be enough to survive? As a wizened boat captain and a prim missionary hurrying downriver in central Africa, Humphrey Bogart and Katharine Hepburn go up against leeches, rapids, and a World War I German warship. Director John Huston's justly loved classic created the modern template for travel as a character-forging crucible—with humor and romance to help the medicine go down.

fields.name: David Jefferys
fields.shortBio: Born in NYC, raised in Delhi & London... the travel bug bit me young.
fields.bio: Born in NYC, raised in Delhi & London. Travel highlights: Early-day excavations of the 16th-century ruins of Vijayanagara, India; Landing on Saba in the Caribbean (twice); Driving lonely roads in Iceland with good music and licorice-covered chocolate; Bathing under Argentine waterfalls at Parque Nacional Iguazú.

featureContentItems.hed: 10 Romantic British Hotels For Every Kind of Honeymooner
featureContentItems.dek: Tropical islands aren't the only destination you should consider for a honeymoon. These 10 romantic hotels in the United Kingdom, selected by [The Good Hotel Guide](http://www.goodhotelguide.com/Editors-choice-honeymoon-hotels-UK), provide excellent dining options, beautiful locations, and—most importantly—romantic locales where honeymooners can focus on each other.

items.title: Hambleton Hall
items.caption: One of Britain’s finest country house hotels, [Hambleton Hall](http://www.hambletonhall.com/) has a spectacular lakeside setting overlooking Rutland Water. The Victorian house oozes charm with luxurious bedrooms combining comfort and style. Honeymooners can take in the quintessential English atmosphere, enjoy the hotel’s intimate setting, and the restaurant’s delicious dishes and award-winning wine list.

items.title: [Burgh Island Hotel](http://www.burghisland.com/)
items.caption: Design aficionados will find plenty to love at this stately inn, which is filled with Art Deco touches. The theme here is English glamour, with rooms named for some of its famous former guests (including Noel Coward, Josephine Baker, and Malcolm Campbell). Rooms come with bespoke toiletries and fancy chocolates, and if you want to have a bit of a lie-in, tea and coffee are brought to your room each morning at your preferred time.

items.title: [The Zetter](http://www.thezetter.com/)
items.caption: The Zetter is a small hotel with a big personality. Make your honeymoon a combination of big city living, with everything London has to offer, complemented by the hotel’s dedication to individual care.  Each of the hotel’s 59 bedrooms has been individually designed in a quirky vintage-modern style, with state-of-the-art in-room entertainment and technology. The best have their own rooftop terraces with fantastic views across London.

items.title: Belle Tout Lighthouse
items.caption: There's something romantic about the idea of staying in a lighthouse—the seclusion of being far away from civilization with just your beloved, maybe? And the dazzling [Belle Tout Lighthouse](http://www.belletout.co.uk/) is an excellent spot for such a getaway. Perched on white cliffs amid dramatic coastal scenery at Beachy Head, the decommissioned lighthouse has been converted into a B&B. Rooms are stylish and unusual—one has a mezzanine bedroom floor reached via the lighthouse's original ladder.

items.title: [The Scarlet ](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-kingdom/mawgan-porth/the-scarlet)
items.caption: A wedding can be the happiest day of your life, sure, but it's also a stressful event. To find post-wedding relaxation, book a stay at [The Scarlet](http://www.scarlethotel.co.uk/), which allows for rejuvenation with a dramatic setting on the rugged Cornish coast. Even better for honeymooners: The hotel has a no-children-allowed policy, so you can relax in a totally grown-up environment. All bedrooms have an outside space to take in the stunning surroundings, and the hotel spa offers couples-specific treatments.

items.title: Hell Bay Hotel
items.caption: [Hell Bay Hotel](http://www.hellbay.co.uk/) takes its name from the bay it faces, but don’t worry: The hotel itself is a haven for honeymooners. On the smallest inhabited Scilly Island, Bryher, this hotel offers a friendly and private oasis to chill out and spend quality time together. Guests can choose from 25 suites ranging in size, most with spectacular views over the Atlantic Ocean. The rooms and public spaces boast works by some of Cornwall’s leading artists. Work off wedding excesses with a spa treatment, a game of tennis or a swim in the heated pool.

items.title: [Lime Wood ](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-kingdom/lyndhurst/lime-wood)
items.caption: In ancient heath and moorland, where wild ponies and donkeys roam free, [Lime Wood](http://www.limewoodhotel.co.uk/home/) has a relaxed air for honeymooners who want to combine understated opulence with a laid-back atmosphere. The Regency manor house offers individually-designed rooms and suites, some with wood-burning fireplaces and private terraces. The hotel’s spa has a rooftop herb garden where you can do yoga and enjoy joint pampering in double treatment rooms.

items.title: La Sablonnerie, Sark
items.caption: Travel back in time by visiting the Channel Island of Sark and stay at [La Sablonnerie](http://www.sablonneriesark.com/). The island doesn’t allow cars, so visitors are greeted at the ferry with a pony and trap. The old-timey vibe continues as you enter the 16th-century farmhouse, whose simple, rustic bedrooms aren't equipped with Wi-Fi or TVs—meaning you'll have more time to focus on each other. Fresh fish, Sark lobster, and home-grown produce from the hotel’s own farm and gardens, make for enjoyable meals.

items.title: Ardanaiseig
items.caption: Just a stone’s throw from the banks of Loch Awe, [Ardanaiseig](http://www.ardanaiseig.com/) gives you a stunning base for a honeymoon that takes advantage of the full beauty of the Highlands. Dating back to 1834, Ardanaiseig was built in the Scottish Baronial style. Every bedroom combines statement pieces and antique furniture with carefully selected accessories and bold decor. After a day exploring the wonders of the Scottish scenery, unwind in front of an open fire in the long drawing room, with paneled walls painted in mottled gold.

items.title: Dart Marina
items.caption: A warm welcome and an enviable riverside setting await honeymooners at [Dart Marina](http://www.dartmarina.com/Home). Every bedroom at the Dartmouth hotel has views of the river—some have balconies with wooden seats positioned perfectly to watch the yachts float by. The chic hotel has a highly-regarded restaurant and plush spa, which together make for a honeymoon of fine dining and top pampering. The hotel is ideally placed for discovering Devon’s coastline.

featureContentItems.seoTitle: 10 Romantic British Hotels For Every Kind of Honeymooner
featureContentItems.seoDescription: These 10 British hotels are perfect for honeymooners, with excellent dining options, beautiful locations, and—most importantly—plenty of romance.
featureContentItems.socialTitle: 10 Romantic British Hotels For Every Kind of Honeymooner
featureContentItems.socialDescription: These 10 British hotels are perfect for honeymooners, with excellent dining options, beautiful locations, and—most importantly—plenty of romance.

featureContentItems.hed: The Best Way to Book a Last-Minute Valentine's Day Trip
featureContentItems.dek: Custom travel specialist Henrietta Loyd says she can turn an itinerary around in 48 hours. Here's how. Plus, more insider wisdom.
featureContentItems.body:
[#image: /photos/54cff6639abb8d533165d7dc]||||||





Spontaneous types, you’re in luck: It’s already February, but you can still book a Valentine’s Day getaway. “These days, people think much more last-minute than ever—I can turn an itinerary around in 48 hours,” says Henrietta Loyd, founder of the custom travel company __[Cazenove+Loyd](cazloyd.com)__. Since February is summer in the Southern Hemisphere, she particularly recommends __[Bahía Vik](bahiavik.com)__ in José Ignacio, Uruguay, the latest property from art collectors/ hoteliers Alex and Carrie Vik. “The beach bungalows are perched on the dunes of Mansa Beach.” Another favorite: __[Vira Vira](hotelviravira.com)__, in Chile’s Lake District, where private villa suites overlook the Liucura River. 

Tom Marchant, co-founder of the luxury travel agency __[Black Tomato](blacktomato.com)__, says that a hassle-free flight starts a trip off on the right foot. “Iceland is easy to get to from both coasts, plus it’s chic and stylish and has a stunning landscape,” he says. His clients always rave about the __[Hótel Rangá](hotelranga.is)__, an hour’s drive from Reykjavík. You can see the East Rangá River and Mount Hekla— without leaving your bed.

*For more romantic travel ideas, check out our [Romantic Getaway Guide](https://cnt.conde.io/reports/special-report-romantic-getaway-guide).*
featureContentItems.seoTitle: The Best Way to Book a Last-Minute Valentine's Day Trip
featureContentItems.seoDescription: Custom travel specialist Henrietta Loyd says she can turn an itinerary around in 48 hours. Here's how.
featureContentItems.socialTitle: The Best Way to Book a Last-Minute Valentine's Day Trip
featureContentItems.socialDescription: Custom travel specialist Henrietta Loyd says she can turn an itinerary around in 48 hours. Here's how.

fields.name: Lauren DeCarlo
fields.shortBio: Lauren DeCarlo is the Articles Editor at Conde Nast Traveler.
fields.bio: Before joining *Traveler*, Lauren was a freelance writer and editor. Her work has appeared in *New York* Magazine, ElleDecor.com, *Lucky*, and *WWD* among other publications.

shortLinksItems.dek: It doesn't need to be Valentine's Day to get a little romantic. Sweep your sweetheart off his or her feet and head to one of these swoon-worthy destinations, full of history and superstition.
shortLinksItems.hed: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World

items.title: Ellis Island
items.caption: Long ago, many joyful family reunions happened at a gate known as the “kissing post.” Share a peck in front of the plaque that stands in its place today, on the first floor in the west wing of the **[building](http://www.ellisisland.org/)**.

items.title: Kiribati
items.caption: Start planning ahead: If you spend New Year’s Eve on this **[Pacific island](http://www.kiribatitourism.gov.ki/)**, which borders the international dateline, you’ll be the first couple in the world to ring in the year with a kiss.

items.title: The Rodin Museum
items.caption: Re-create the passion depicted in the 19th-century sculpture, _The Kiss,_ before taking a romantic stroll in **[the museum](http://www.musee-rodin.fr)**’s rambling rose garden.

items.title: The Kissing Bench
items.caption: Legend says that if a couple kisses while sitting on **[this stone bench](http://archives.syr.edu/exhibits/spirit_social.html) **at Syracuse University, they’ll eventually marry.

items.title: The Bridge of Sighs
items.caption: According to Italian superstition, kiss your sweetheart on a gondola at sunset under **[this 17th-century bridge](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bridge_of_Sighs)**, and you'll be guaranteed eternal love.
The ferris wheel at Santa Monica Pier

items.title: Hôtel de Ville
items.caption: Star in your own version of Robert Doisneau’s iconic photograph, _The Kiss on the Sidewalk,_ by visiting Paris’s city hall, the [**Hôtel de Ville**](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hôtel_de_Ville,_Paris). (To kiss in the exact spot, stand across from the “C” at the café.)

items.title: Lovers Point
items.caption: Head here at the crack of dawn and share a morning kiss; because it faces east, it’s one of the only spots on the west coast where you watch the sun rise over the water.

items.title: Juliet's Balcony
items.caption: Shakespeare’s star-crossed sweethearts declared undying love for one another here. Kiss beneath **[the balcony](http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g187871-d246496-Reviews-Juliet_s_House_Casa_di_Giulietta-Verona_Province_of_Verona_Veneto.html)** before parting, with such sweet sorrow.

items.title: The Eiffel Tower
items.caption: Once dubbed “the metal asparagus,” the **[Eiffel Tower](http://www.tour-eiffel.fr)** is now arguably one of the most romantic spots in the world. Take an elevator to the third level, and share a French kiss over the city.

items.title: The Empire State Building
items.caption: Salute _Sleepless in Seattle_ (or have your own _Affair to Remember_) by making a pilgrimage to this **[New York landmark](http://www.esbnyc.com/)**. (Our advice: Skip rush hour and make a late-night trip to the top—you can go as late as 1:15am.)

items.title: Kingda Ka Rollercoaster at Six Flags Great Adventure
items.caption: Experts say that thrills get your endorphins pumping, which makes you more attracted to those around you. Kiss at the top of the first hill on **[the world’s tallest rollercoaster](http://www.sixflags.com/greatadventure/rides/kingdaka.aspx)**—it’s 45 stories high!—and hang on to each other as you plummet.

items.title: The Kissing Bridge
items.caption: This **[rickety covered bridge](http://www.woolwich.ca/en/tourism/thingstodo_kissing_bridge.asp)** might not look like much, but the dreamy light inside earned it its name. It was originally built in 1881 and is Ontario's last remaining covered bridge.

items.title: Père Lachaise Cemetery
items.caption: Here lies author and poet Oscar Wilde, whose devotees covered his tomb in **[layers of kisses](http://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/16/world/europe/oscar-wildes-tomb-sealed-from-admirers-kisses.html?pagewanted=all)** over the years. In 2011, the tomb was cleaned, and a seven-foot glass wall was erected—but now visitors leave kisses on the glass. Swipe on some red lipstick, and add yours.

items.title: Alley of the Kiss
items.caption: Two lovers living on opposite sides of this **[slender alley](http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g150799-d153080-Reviews-Alley_of_the_Kiss_Callejon_del_Beso-Guanajuato_Central_Mexico_and_Gulf_Coast.html)** once perished side-by-side here; since then, locals have allegedly spotted their ghosts smooching on the balconies. Today, local lore says that couples who kiss on the third step in the alley will be rewarded with years of happiness.

shortLinksItems.seoDescription: It doesn't need to be Valentine's Day to get a little romantic. Sweep your sweetheart off his or her feet and head to one of these swoon-worthy destinations, full of history and superstition.
shortLinksItems.seoTitle: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World
shortLinksItems.socialDescription: It doesn't need to be Valentine's Day to get a little romantic. Sweep your sweetheart off his or her feet and head to one of these swoon-worthy destinations, full of history and superstition.
shortLinksItems.socialTitle: The 15 Most Romantic Places to Kiss Around the World

shortLinksItems.dek: Candlelit dinners on Wailea Beach? Couples’ massage classes by the ocean? Romantic day trips to hidden Maui waterfalls? Don’t worry—we got you. Just in time for Valentine’s Day, we rounded up the most romantic Hawaiian getaways of them all.

items.title: Four Seasons Maui
items.caption: It’s no wonder that most guests at the [Four Seasons Maui](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/kihei/four-seasons-maui-at-wailea) are honeymooners, babymooners, or couples celebrating their anniversary: romance oozes from every corner. From unforgettable sunsets over Wailea Beach to the West Maui Mountain views from the adults-only Serenity Pool (one of our [favorite pools](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/2) on the island), you won’t find a better backdrop for rekindling romance. This Valentine’s Day, spend the afternoon practicing massage techniques on one another at a couples’ instructional massage class on the beach. Afterward, enjoy a private, custom, multi-course oceanfront dinner, complete with wine and candlelight. Cliché? We prefer to think it’s classic.

items.title: Halekulani Hotel
items.caption: Honolulu's iconic [Halekulani Hotel](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/honolulu/halekulani--waikiki) inspires romance all year round, thanks to that [gorgeous orchid pool](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/5), and sweeping ocean views. If the ambiance alone isn't romantic enough for you, Halekulani will also sponsor your date night with complimentary tickets to the Hawaii Symphony Orchestra. Or, if you'd prefer, you can enjoy an art tour of Honolulu and stroll hand-in-hand through the former residence of a Hawaiian king and queen. This Valentine's Day, don't miss SpaHalekulani's "Celebrate Love" package: a couple's massage paired with custom-blended essential oils followed, naturally, by chocolates and champagne.

items.title: St. Regis Princeville Resort
items.caption: [This resort](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/princeville/st--regis-princeville--kauai) will surely make you fall in love—if not with your partner, then certainly with the spectacular views surrounding you. It's nestled in a quiet cove overlooking gorgeous Hanalei Bay and Bali Hai, with a rocky, secluded beach better suited for romantic sunset strolls than swimming. This Valentine's Day, the resort's Halele'a Spa is offering a sumptuous champagne scrub, finished off with a body butter treatment made using locally-sourced Ali'i lavender. Afterward, indulge in a four-course private dinner illuminated by torchlight on secluded Kamani Cove, or dine at the resort's very own [Jean-Georges restaurant](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-09/food-photos-hawaii-beautiful-dishes-instagram/5). Cap off the evening with a cocktail and a midnight soak in the resort's 24/7 hot tub.

items.title: Sheraton Waikiki Hotel
items.caption: If your definition of romance involves hitting the town in high style, then the [Sheraton Waikiki](http://www.sheraton-waikiki.com/) is where you need to be. Smack in the middle of Waikiki Beach, it's a stone's throw away from some of Honolulu's most romantic restaurants and hottest nightclubs, and is home to the best pool bar in town, The Edge of Waikiki. Young-at-heart couples will find nothing more romantic than floating on those signature orange beanbags, hand-in-hand (mai tai in the other), watching the sun set over bustling Waikiki. Ask about their Romance Packages, which gets you an ocean view and a complimentary bottle of champagne.

items.title: Andaz Maui at Waliea
items.caption: Judging from the crowd alone, the sleek lobby of the [Andaz Maui](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/wailea/andaz-maui-at-wailea) could easily be mistaken for a Brooklyn boutique hotel: it's studded with abstract art and hip, skinny jeans-clad couples who look like they've just stepped off the subway. This is the place to be if your idea of romance includes artisanal cocktails by an edgy pool ( [or four](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-11/hawaiis-best-hotel-pools/3)) and an organic, locally-sourced, farm-to-table dinner with your sweetheart. This Valentine's Day, have their (young, super hip) concierge organize a private waterfall tour of East Maui—because what's more romantic than sharing a kiss beneath your own secret, 40-foot waterfall?

items.title: The Royal Hawaiian
items.caption: We promise, we didn't just choose [this hotel](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/honolulu/royal-hawaiian--luxury-collection-) because it's pink—besides its hue, it's got so much to offer in the way of romance. First, there are suites with enormous soaking tubs and views over the ocean. Then (if you can drag yourself out of that tub) there's the Abhasa Spa, where you can get a couples' massage beneath the shade of swaying palms inside the hotel's own coconut grove. Finally, there's a spectacular Valentine's Day prix fixe at its acclaimed Azure restaurant, where you can expect an abundance of truffles, oysters and to-die-for desserts (check out the full V-Day menu [here](http://www.azurewaikiki.com/pdf/valentines-day-15.pdf)). This Valentine's Day, a Romance Package will get you breakfast in bed, and flowers and champagne upon arrival.

items.title: Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort and Spa
items.caption: With its location on windy Shipwreck beach and its labyrinth of gorgeous pools and lagoons, the [Grand Hyatt Kauai](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/koloa/grand-hyatt-kauai-resort-and-spa) is like a gigantic, romantic adult playground. There's a waterfall and freshwater grotto to swim in, and an outdoor fire pit to snuggle by. This Valentine's Day, indulge in a couples' treatment at the resort's award-winning Anara Spa, followed by dinner at its famous floating restaurant, Tidepools—frequently called out as one of the most romantic in the country.
items.credit: Courtesy Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort And Spa

items.title: Four Seasons Resort Hualalai
items.caption: With its secluded black sand beaches and deep, lush valleys, the Big Island might just be the most romantic of all Hawaii's islands. The [Four Seasons Resort Hualalai](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/big-island/four-seasons-hualalai-at-historic-ka-upulehu--big-island), on the island's Kona-Kohala Coast, plays up that drama: it's built upon a backdrop of turquoise ocean, black lava, and lush green vegetation. If you can manage to tear yourself away from the stunning scenery and back into your bungalow-style digs, we suggest splurging on an in-room duet massage, followed by the "Love Potion" experience: an in-room martini-making kit, plus vanilla-scented candles, strawberries, and a pot of melted chocolate for dipping (or drizzling).

items.title: Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa
items.caption: We know what you're thinking: romance? At a [family-friendly resort](http://cntraveler.com/united-states/kapolei/aulani-disney-resort--oahu)? Don't judge a book by its cover: Mickey and Minnie know you need your alone time, too. Kick off Valentine's Day by dropping the kids off at Aunty's Beach House, open until 9:30 pm. Saunter over to Kula Wai, a 5,000-square-foot hydrotherapy garden where you and your sweetheart can soak together in purifying volcanic mud bath, followed by a traditional *lomilomi* couples' massage. Spend the afternoon exploring scenic Ko'Olina Lagoon, and then enjoy a sunset champagne toast at the adults-only Wailana pool bar. You'll emerge from your date feeling relaxed, sunkissed and—dare we say—sexy.
items.credit: Courtesy Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa

items.title: Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay
items.caption: Perched atop a craggy, red lava cliff above a white sand beach, the views from [this resort](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/lanai-city/four-seasons-lana-i-at-manele-bay) look like something out of a movie. The accommodations are equally swoon-worthy: oceanfront suites boast deep Japanese wooden soaking tubs and generous lanais, perfect for sunset-watching. This Valentine's Day, take your S.O. to the resort's boutique perfumery to create your own custom fragrance together. Couples can choose from over 200 different scents—made from 100% natural and indigenous Hawaiian ingredients—to craft into the perfect olfactory souvenir.
items.credit: Courtesy Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay

items.title: THE MODERN Honolulu
items.caption: If you're in Honolulu and looking for a Valentine's Day experience that's a little more intimate and low-key, [THE MODERN](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/oahu/the-modern-honolulu)'s your best bet. It's away from the main drag of chain hotels on Waikiki, and is home to the island's sexiest cocktail bar, which is literally hidden behind a rotating wall of books off the lobby. Kick off your Valentine's Day with their "Breakfast in Daybed," where they'll set you up with a mimosa bar and brunch on a daybed by the Sunrise Pool. Afterward, indulge in a couple's in-room spa treatment, have a romantic [lunch at Morimoto](http://www.cntraveler.com/galleries/2014-12-09/food-photos-hawaii-beautiful-dishes-instagram/8) and then watch the sun set with a cocktail by the aptly-named, adults-only Sunset Pool, outfitted with hammocks roomy enough for two.

items.title: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa
items.caption: No wonder it's one of the most popular places to get married in Honolulu: with its elegant, plantation style architecture, dramatic pillared _porte-cochere_ and dripping crystal chandeliers, the [Moana Surfrider](http://cntraveler.com/hotels/honolulu/moana-surfrider-a-westin-resort-and-spa) certainly _looks_ like the most romantic hotel in all of Waikiki. Spend this Valentine's Day enjoying contemporary island cuisine at its gorgeous Beachhouse restaurant (on this year's menu: oysters, Alaskan king crab, and red velvet cake), indulging in a couples' hot stone treatment, or simply sitting beneath the 150-foot branches of its historic banyan tree, doing absolutely nothing at all.
items.credit: Courtesy Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa

items.title: Mauna Lani Bay Hotel & Bungalows
items.caption: Since its opening in 1983, [the Mauna Lani](http://www.cntraveler.com/hotels/united-states/kamuela/mauna-lani-bay-hotel---bungalows--big-island) has been a favorite among honeymooners, and it remains one of the Big Island's most classically beautiful resorts. Besides its dreamy Kohala Coast location, the main draw for couples is its fantastic spa—a sheer volcanic oasis that's arguably the best on the island. Couples can steam together in the open-air, volcanic rock sauna, or indulge in simultaneous treatments in the lava-enhanced saltwater Watsu Pool. For the ultimate Valentine's Day experience, splurge on a bungalow for your own oceanfront private plunge pool.
items.credit: Courtesy Mauna Lani Bay Hotel & Bungalows

fields.name: Krisanne Fordham
fields.shortBio: Krisanne Fordham is a contributing editor at *Condé Nast Traveler*
fields.bio: Krisanne Fordham is a contributing digital editor at *Condé Nast Traveler* and a writer for CNN Travel, *Departures* and *Travel + Leisure.* Previously, she was a staff editor at *Condé Nast Traveler* and The AOL-Huffington Post Media Group. Krisanne grew up in Sydney, Australia and splits her time between New York and Italy.

shortLinksItems.hed: French Kiss: Vintage Photos of Romance Along Paris's Seine River
shortLinksItems.dek: Few activities scream romance quite like a leisurely walk along the Seine River in Paris—and these vintage photos prove that the famed waterway has been a draw for ages.

items.title: __Paris, 1962__
items.caption:
“Back then, everyone was kissing in the streets,” recalls Hans Mauli of his image of a couple embracing along the Seine. The 77-year-old Swiss-born photographer came upon the pair—possibly students, judging from the workbook at her side—close to the Sorbonne and the Boulevard St-Michel. “I leaned over the stone wall and held the camera in my outstretched hands,” says Mauli, who shot only one frame of the young lovers. Known for his black-and-white photography, he rarely used color film due to the expense. “I didn’t have much money at the time, so I often kept unprocessed film for years,” Mauli says. Though he knew he had taken a good shot, he didn’t print it until some 35 years later. Mauli, who now lives in St. Helena, California, still believes Paris is a city that inspires romance (“Everything is beautiful—the light, the architecture, the river”), but he isn’t sure there are as many displays of public passion these days: “So many people are looking at their smartphones instead of looking at each other.” 

For more vintage photos of romance on the Seine, click through the slideshow…
Kissing near the Eiffel Tower.
A couple embraces on the banks of the Seine.
items.credit: © Thurston Hopkins / Picture Post / Getty Images

items.caption: A courting couple kissing on the steps on the bank of the river.
items.credit: © Fred Van Schagen / BIPs / Hulton Archive / Getty Images

items.caption: Lovers on the quayside beside the Seine.
Lovers walk past barges on the Seine.
A couple in a hidden nook near the river.
Lovers on one of Paris's many bridges.
More couples have a romantic liaison on the waterfront.
A couple embraces in front of the Notre Dame, Ile-de-France.
Kissing during the flooding of the Seine in 1978.

items.title: Circa 1983
items.caption: Summer on the banks of the Seine.
Young lovers set up camp by the water on a beautiful, clear day.

items.title: Circa 2005
items.caption: A young couple near Notre Dame.
